markdownRemark.html:
“Mendicants, there are ten wrong ways. What ten? Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom. These are the ten wrong ways.”

AN.10.133. Ekādasamasutta (“Eleventh”)

children.value:
“Mendicants, there are ten wrong ways.
What ten?
Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.
These are the ten wrong ways.”

markdownRemark.excerpt:
“Mendicants, there are ten wrong ways. 
What ten? 
Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort…

prev.excerpt: “Mendicants, these ten things when developed and cultivated don’t lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight…

next.excerpt:
“Mendicants, I will teach you what is good and what is not good. 
Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”  “Yes, sir,” they replied…
